title: Job Vacancies at TAG Energy
content:
TAG Energy is an integrated service company offering a comprehensive range of oilfield products and support services in the Nigerian Oil and Gas Industry.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Driver

Job Location: Lekki / Ajah - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Map out driving routes ahead of time to determine the most expedient trip.
	Collect payments and issue receipts.
	Assist with loading and unloading luggage.
	Listen to traffic and weather reports to stay up-to-date on road conditions.
	Adjust the route to avoid heavy traffic or road constructions, as needed.
	Ensure the car seats are clean and comfortable for all riders.
	Schedule regular car service appointments and report any issues.
	Book car wash and detailing services to maintain interior and exterior cleanliness of the car.


General Requirements


	Minimum: S.S.C.E.
	5+ years of experience as a driver
	Possess a current and valid driver's license
	Must be married.
	Must be 35 years and above.
	Ability to use Google Maps and other navigation tools effectively.
	Strong attention to detail to ensure safety and accuracy in delivery.
	Excellent verbal communication skills.


Salary
N120,000 Monthly plus 10,500 weekly feeding allowance.

Application Closing Date: 30th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruit4talents1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: No Accommodation.

 

 

2.) Instrument Technician

Job Location: Offshore - Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Responsibilities


	Must possess a broad knowledge of instrument, control, and electrical systems.
	Maintain and service instruments
	Install new products, and test them to ensure they are working correctly.
	Diagnose problems and come up with solutions to repair them.
	Order parts needed for repairs if needed.
	Fill out detailed reports and keep records on services that have been performed.
	Explain issues with equipment and repairs to customers.


General Requirements


	HND / B.Eng in General Engineering and other related field.
	Minimum of 3 years and above of relevant work experience.
	Problem solving skill.
	Must be skilled in using Microsoft Office including: Outlook, Word, Excel, and Powerpoint.
	Attention to detail when performing tasks.
	Critical and Analytical thinking.
	Able to work under moderate or no supervision.
	Experience in Field Instrumentation Testing, Measurement and Calibration Fault finding and Repair
	Understanding of Loop and schematic drawing.


Application Closing Date: 31st July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruit4talents1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Mechanical Technician

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Responsibilities


	Mechanical maintenance, testing and calibration of PSVs.
	Ensure mechanical operations, standards and controls are maintained at high quality.
	Check equipment and operating systems and correct wherever necessary.
	Resolve motor, valves, pump, conveyor, and hydraulic problems.
	Ensure high level technical support to lower level technicians.
	Handle simple and complex heavy industrial equipment like forklifts, scissor lifts, basket trucks and bobcats.
	Comply with the company and customer regulations and policies.


General Requirements


	HND / B.Eng in Mechanical engineering or any related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience as a mechanical technician.
	Analytical, Critical thinking and Problem solving abilities.
	Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
	Extensive knowledge of mechanical engineering designs, installations, maintenance and repairs.
	Willingness to perform mechanical maintenance and repairs outside business hour.


Application Closing Date: 30th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruit4talents1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

4.) IT Support Officer

Job Location: Lekki / Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Provide first-level technical support to end-users for software, hardware, and network-related issues.
	Troubleshoot and resolve hardware and software problems efficiently.
	Perform routine maintenance and upgrades on IT systems and devices.
	Configure and manage custom domains, email accounts, and related settings.
	Assist in the setup and configuration of networks, routers, firewalls, and security protocols.
	Monitor system performance and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and security.
	Ensure proper documentation of issues and resolutions.
	Support Microsoft Office Suite applications and maintain licensing compliance.
	Collaborate with other departments to understand and address their IT needs.
	Create basic visual content using Canva or other design tools for internal communications or IT documentation (optional but a plus).


General Requirements


	BSC or HND in computer science, Information Technology or related field
	1-2 years of experience in IT support role or related field
	Good knowledge of software and hardware troubleshooting
	Good knowledge of networking and related configurations
	Candidates should reside around Lekki
	Good knowledge of security principles in IT
	Experience working with Custom Domains and configurations
	Good knowledge of Microsoft suites
	Good design knowledge with Canva or design software is a plus


Application Closing Date: 30th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruit4talents1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Recovery / Collection Officer Job at Workforce Group




        
    

        
        At Workforce Group, we go beyond narrowly defined client issues, beyond conventional wisdom, beyond the expected, to create opportunities for our clients, candidates, colleagues, collaborators, and community. Through a network of diversified but highly complementary lines of businesses we have helped some of the most important and exciting organisations on the continent find the critical talent, access cutting edge advice and get innovative support they require to grow in a challenging market.

We support businesses and organisations of varying size, structure and maturity across diverse sectors such as Technology, Telecoms, Oil & Gas, Financial Services, Third Sector, FMCG etc. to enhance business performance, optimise for growth and achieve exceptional results.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Recovery / Collection Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time




Requirements


	Minimum of OND.
	Proven experience as a debt collector
	Ability to work with performance targets and deadlines
	Knowledge of relevant legal guidelines and recovery procedures
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and database systems
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
	Confidence, politeness, and empathy in client interactions


Work Schedule:


	Work Hours: 8:30 am – 5:30 pm
	Break Period: 12:00 pm – 1:00 pm
	Work Days: Shift system (5 days a week)


Benefits


	Salary: N100,000 Monthly (Net)
	Performance pay.
	Transport allowance
	Full attendance bonus
	Health insurance
	Public holiday overtime pay
